about.title: About the Project
about.intro: The Global Prosperity Barometer (GPB) is an open-data civic platform that monitors and visualizes prosperity indicators across countries worldwide.
about.mission.title: Our Mission
about.mission.text: To make government performance and societal progress transparent, comparable, and accessible to everyone through open data and clear visualization.
about.pillars.title: The 12 Pillars
about.pillars.text: We measure prosperity across 12 interconnected dimensions, from governance quality to housing affordability. Each pillar is scored 0–100 based on publicly available data from international organizations.
about.open.title: Open Data
about.open.text: All data comes from publicly accessible sources including the World Bank, United Nations, Freedom House, V-Dem Institute, and others. We do not collect any personal data from visitors.
about.contact.title: Contact
about.contact.text: Questions or feedback? Reach us at
methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.scoring.title: Scoring System
methodology.scoring.text: Each pillar is scored on a 0–100 scale, where 100 represents the best observed performance globally. Scores are derived from multiple sub-indicators normalized to this scale.
methodology.sources.title: Data Sources
methodology.sources.text: We aggregate data from the following international organizations and databases:
methodology.update.title: Update Frequency
methodology.update.text: Scores are updated as new data becomes available from source organizations, typically on an annual basis. The platform reflects the most recent available data.
methodology.limitations.title: Limitations
methodology.limitations.text: No single index can fully capture the complexity of national prosperity. Our scores should be viewed as approximate indicators based on available data, not definitive rankings.
impressum.title: Legal Notice
impressum.provider.name: GPB World Initiative
impressum.responsible.name: Civic Data Team
impressum.liability.title: Liability for Content
impressum.liability.text: All data comes from publicly accessible sources (World Bank, Freedom House, UN, V-Dem). The platform has no political agenda.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.highlight: We collect NO personal data. No cookies. No tracking.
privacy.collection.title: 1. Data Collection
privacy.analytics.title: Analytics
privacy.analytics.text: We use GoatCounter for anonymous statistics:
privacy.hosting.title: 2. Hosting
privacy.hosting.text: GitHub Pages — GitHub stores server logs for max 90 days (security).
privacy.sources.title: 3. External Sources
privacy.rights.title: 4. Your Rights
privacy.rights.text: Since we collect no personal data, there is nothing to disclose, correct, or delete.
privacy.contact.title: 5. Contact
footer.copyright: © 2026 Global Prosperity Barometer | Open Data Platform
about.support.title: Support This Project
about.support.text: The Global Prosperity Barometer is free, open, and independent. If you find it useful, you can support its continued development.
